p: Rasamison et al. also isolated seven furoquinolines from the stem bark of the Madagascan species, Melicope madagascariensis (Rutaceae), of which only compound 7 (6-methoxy-7-hydroxydictamnine, commonly called heliparvifoline) exhibited weak anti-malarial activity against the CQ-resistant strain, Dd2, with IC 50 = 35 μM, the other compounds tested being inactive [ 60].
